author: jason.carver
content:
Does anyone have opinions / attachment to old glados data?
Much of the time I'd say I am looking at data from just the last week, most of the time within the 2-3 weeks. On rare occasions, I've gone as far back as 4-6 weeks. It currently looks like we have ~1yr of data.
The reason I'm bringing it up now is that glados pages load much too slowly. I'm considering deleting old data as one of the options for speeding it up. Obviously there are several paths to performance improvement, but that's probably the lowest engineering time.

author: kolbyml
content: I don't think there is that much value in the old data, especially since at this stage the network is mostly just us running nodes. So if you want to prune the database I see no problems with that üëç

author: deme1744
content: I also prefer faster page load over long history at this point

author: paulj
content: An improved page load would be great. I ended up turning off alerts I had for glados uptime because I kept getting false positives just because of how long it would take to get a `200` response.
